content.description: Challenging fist crack start to a bolted crux pulling a small roof.    Some questionable rock quality - hence the bolt.   Finish with a finger-hand crack that accepts as much gear as you want to place.   Fun route!!    Probably done before but never posted.
content.protection: Standard rack stoppers .4-#3 cammalot. Extra #2 helpful.   No anchors
content.location: Ten feet right of Chocolate Raspberry Truffles    Climb the fist crack up to a small roof finishing with a fun finger -hand crack.   Walk off

content.description: Crux at the start, it jumps right on you! Once you gain the crack 5.7-8 it's So fun!   Tape up if your jamming technique is not great!   The route is short but sweet as cake!
content.protection: Cams from .4 -#2 cammalot    Two bolt anchor at top.   A perfect TR for practicing jamming techniques
content.location: Located approximately 100' left -NE- of Fascination Street. Scramble up a rock ledge to a nice flat belay area- can't miss this SWEET hand crack.   Access from top actually easier if you know where route is located.

content.description: Multiple cruxes-    #1- transitioning to crack from dehideral    #2- getting out of the "pod"   #3-Actual Crux- the finger crack above the "pod"   Get a good rest at the "pod" then fire the finger crack until you get the Awesome hand jam!!! Great pro so no worries
content.protection: Stoppers up to #13   Cams -green Alien through #3Cammalot - doubles in finger sizes may help.   Use two bolt hangers on top of "Dave" for anchors
content.location: The beautiful crack to the right of Dave The Evangelist . Left of the black water streak.   Start up the wide dehideral then move left when you can reach the finger crack on the face.   Walk off.

content.description: This route offers great diversity for a climb of its length. Start by stemming up the left-facing dihedral below the giant roof. Upon reaching the roof traverse left along a fingertip traverse to a bolt. It is wise to use an over-the-shoulder sling on last piece of gear placed in the corner plus on the bolt at the end of the traverse. Move up and right on overhanging rock past several more bolts. Climb the flake above to a bolt then move up and left to the anchors.
content.protection: 1 set of stoppers, 1 set of cams up to 3.5", 1 set of RPs, a couple of over-the-shoulder slings.

content.description: This route is a closed project at this point. It follows the arete on the right side of the large roof formation.
content.protection: There are about ten bolts on this route.

content.description: Good gear all the way! Crux is pulling the two distinct ledges.
content.protection: Standard rack- stoppers -cams.4-#4cammalots    No anchor at top
content.location: Right of the large roof & bolted arÃªte (Dave)   Shares the same start as Raspberry Belay   Walk off

content.description: This buttress is actually the begining of the main formation at Raspberry Rocks. There is a very large roof capping a left facing dihedral. To the right of the roof formation is a distinctive gray and black water streak. This buttress is just past and slightly behind the north end of The West Face.
